intro: Ranunculus cyprius, commonly known as the Cyprus buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features a basal rosette of deeply lobed, dark green leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive central blotch. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers are often used in floral arrangements due to their delicate appearance and short blooming period.
